title: Nogales City Council violates Open Meeting Law | Local News | nogalesinternational.com
text: An Attorney General investigation concluded that the Nogales City Council violated several elements of Arizona’s Open Meeting Law when it privately met with representatives of a mining company back in March. In a disposition letter dated Oct. 10, the Arizona Attorney General’s Office outlined that the City Council failed to properly post public notices prior to the meeting, held a private meeting without a valid reason for executive session, and failed to provide minutes, recordings or documentation that shed light on the meeting. kAm“(:E9@FE >:?FE6D[ E9:D ~77:46 42??@E 36 46CE2:? @7 H92E 92AA6?65 2E E9:D >66E:?8[” E96 pEE@C?6J v6?6C2=’D ~77:46 HC@E6 :?
